item.title: CUDA, PyTorch and VSC Installation on Windows 10
item.description:
DW Sun https://dw-sun.github.io/post/cuda_pytorch_vsc/ -

My old laptop(Thinkpad W520) has a GPU, i want to use it to learn some AI technologies, this notes lists the key messages to configure a Nvidia GPU enabled development environment

1. Review latest online guide -> 2. Find out the GPU Model info -> 3. find out the latest GPU driver version -> 4. determine the CUDA Toolkit version -> 5. Review the selected version CUDA toolkit online guide -> 6. Chose the VSC version and install -> 7. Install the CUDA tool kit -> 8. Chose the the PyTorch version and install

Preparing

Review the CUDA Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows, key points below:

  1. A CUDA-capable GPU
  2. A supported version of Microsoft Visual Studio
  3. A workable NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit version for your GPU

GPU check and driver installation

  1. Check the GPU model - NVIDIA Quadro 1000M
  2. Find the GPU latest driver and install it
    • https://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-us
  3. According the driver version number, determine which CUDA Toolkit version is workable for my laptop
    • https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-toolkit-release-notes/index.html#major-components
    • My GPU driver highest version is 377.55, so the hightest workable CUDA toolkit version is v8.0.61 with my laptop
  4. According the CUDA Toolkit version, choose the VSC version
    • Change to CUDA Toolkit v8 online documents, review the installation guide
    • https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/archive/8.0/
    • https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/archive/8.0/cuda-installation-guide-microsoft-windows/index.html
    • The CUDA Toolkit version is v8, then i choose Visual Studio Community 2015

VSC Install

Install Visual Studio Community 2015. Make sure to include all C++ features

CUDA Install

Install CUDA toolkit v8.0.61

PyTorch Install(CUDA enabled)

  1. Review get started
    • Find the highest PyTroch version which is available for CUDA toolkit v8. The version is v1.0.0
  2. Download the pip whl packages:
    • https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-1.0.0-cp37-cp37m-win_amd64.whl
  3. Create venv, and install pytorch 
    python -m venv cuda80
source cuda80/scripts/active
pip install torch-1.0.0-cp37-cp37m-win_amd64.whl
pip install torchvision==0.2.1

# this package is needed by pytorch
pip install numpy
  4. Verify the installation 
    import torch

print( torch.__version__ )

x = torch.rand(5, 3)
print(x)

print( torch.cuda.is_available() )
- https://dw-sun.github.io/post/cuda_pytorch_vsc/ - DW Sun 2020

item.title: Google Analytics
item.description:
DW Sun https://dw-sun.github.io/post/google_analytics/ -

What is Google Analytics

It is used to help you understand how your web site are accessing. With it, you can learn which part of your web is good, or bad; you can know how many user was/are accessing your web, where are they from….; then you can improve the website accordingly.

It is also for Android app, and iOS app.

The steps to use it

  1. login https://marketingplatform.google.com/about/analytics/

  2. Create Account - from Admin menu -> Account -> Create Account

  3. Create Property - from Admin menu -> Property -> Create Property

    • The web site need to be verified by google before it can be analysis

  4. Check

    • access the web site
    • report -> real time

  5. Study the reports to enhance your website

- https://dw-sun.github.io/post/google_analytics/ - DW Sun 2020

item.title: Hugo and RobotsTxt
item.description:
DW Sun https://dw-sun.github.io/post/hugo_robots/ -

How Hugo support RobotsTxt

  1. Config config.toml

    enableRobotsTXT = true

# production or non-production, usually production env would allow search engine to crawl everything
[params].env = "production"

  2. run hugo command to generate the web site

    • a robots.txt will be generated in public directory

  3. robots.txt templates are existing in layouts/robots.txt file, or themes/ananke/layouts/robots.txt file

    • the templates would affects the content of the generated public/robots.txt

RobotsTxt samples

  1. Which tells search engines that they are allowed to crawl everything:

    User-agent: *
Disallow:

  2. Which tells search engines that they are NOT allowed to crawl anything:

    User-agent: *
Disallow: /
- https://dw-sun.github.io/post/hugo_robots/ - DW Sun 2020
